author: Reuters
description: Facebook is set to pay up to $250,000 for the longer, scripted shows
title: Facebook Reportedly Signs BuzzFeed, Vox and Others for Original Video Shows

author: Christina Farr
description: Facebook is hosting an invite-only summit in June to court health industry leaders.
title: Facebook is making a big push this summer to sell ads to drugmakers

author: Catherine Buni and Soraya Chemaly
description: Users post text, images, and more relentlessly on Facebook, where teams of thousands cannot scramble fast enough to scrub them off the site.
title: How do you fix Facebook moderation’s problem? Figure out what Facebook is

author: Joe Miller
description: Share Lab uses flow charts and data analysis to map one of the greatest forces shaping our world - Facebook.
title: How Facebook's tentacles reach further than you think

author: Napier Lopez
description: Facebook introduced personal fundraisers in beta back in March, taking on services like GoFundMe, butwith a a particular focus on critical needs like disaster relief and education. ...
title: Facebook expands GoFundMe-like fundraiser service to everyone in the US

author: Napier Lopez
description:
Facebook is introducing a couple of changes today that make it easier to spot trending topics and the coverage around them.

First up, there's a bit of a visual redesign. Previously, ...
title: Facebook redesigns Trending topics to make news easier to find

author: Tony Lee
description: Facebook chief Mark Zuckerberg choked up while speaking about an illegal immigrant “DREAMer” during his Harvard commencement speech.
title: Facebook’s Zuckerberg: Fight Against Nationalism ‘Struggle of our Time’ - Breitbart

author: Charlie Nash
description: Facebook moderators have been ordered to remove "dehumanizing" posts about migrants and refugees, but not Holocaust denial posts.
title: Report: Facebook Moderators Told to Remove 'Dehumanizing' Posts About Refugees, But Not Holocaust Denial Posts - Breitbart

author: Nick Statt
description: Facebook announced today that it’s making its Instant Articles platform compatible with competing web publishing standards like Google AMP and Apple News. That way, publishers can build first in...
title: Facebook is trying to salvage Instant Articles by adding support for Google AMP

author: Spiegel Online
description: Facebook-Gründer und Uni-Abbrecher Mark Zuckerberg ist für eine Abschlussrede nach Harvard zurückgekehrt. Vor Absolventen schwärmt er von einer besseren Welt. Soll er doch in seiner Firma anfangen.
title: Harvard-Rede von Mark Zuckerberg: Rette doch erst einmal Facebook
